climbs.name: Where's Madagascar?
climbs.fa: Jeff Brennan, Pat Brennan and Kenn Kenaga, September 2001

content.description: Undercling and smear your way past a bolt into a thin left-facing flake and when that ends move past one more bolt via featured face to anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts, gear to1 inch, bolted anchor
content.location: Left side of the north face and identified by a bolt at the bottom.

climbs.name: The Straight and Narrow
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan and Jeff Brennan, August 2001

content.description: This climbs a short but enjoyable hand crack to gear belay.
content.location:
Left side of the north face and just right of

Sail Boat

.

climbs.name: Sail Boat
climbs.fa: Jeff Brennan, Pat Brennan and Kenn Kenaga, September 2001

content.description: Face climb past a bolt into a short but nice finger crack that doesn't quite reach the ground.
content.protection: Bolt, gear to 1.5 inches, bolted anchor
content.location:
Left side of the north face and just right of

Where's Madagascar?

.

content.description: Wiggle up the prominent and colorful crack that runs from hands to off-width.
content.location:
Widening crack between

The Straight and Narrow

and

Going to War

.

climbs.name: One for All
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan and Jeff Brennan, September 2001

content.description: A nice easy low-angled crack that might make a great first gear lead.
content.location:
Left of

Where's Madagascar?

on the east face.

climbs.name: Inner Space
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan and Jeff Brennan, September 2001

content.description: A short but physical exercise in wide crack climbing.
content.location:
Right of

Green Carpet

is this wide crack.

climbs.name: Ground Zero
climbs.fa: Kenn Kenaga, Jeff Brennan and Bob Cable, September 2001

content.description: Make difficult face moves past a bolt into a lieback which turns to a hand crack higher.

climbs.name: Green Carpet
climbs.fa: Jeff Brennan and Pat Brennan, September 2001

content.description: Enjoy the soft jams as you jam this lichen covered crack.
content.location:
Two routes right of the wide crack of

Psychedelic

.

content.description: Climbs a series of flakes to a left-leaning crack that dies out below the top.
content.location:
Located between

Psychedelic

and Green Carpet.

content.description: A short lieback flake leads to face climbing on this top-rope problem.
content.location:
Located around and right from

Ground Zero

on the west face.
